messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: scary shows
messages.msgSnippet: ... a ... is ... prove ... Well, I have had three personal experiences with the second.  Call me what you will, unscientific, superstitious whatever - I
messages.messageBody:
>
> >The difference between "I believe there is life on other planets" and "I
> >believe there are ghosts/astral projection" is that the first is based on
a
> >huge body of concrete data (us!) and testable, provable ideas. The second
is
> >based only on theories that can't be tested and proved. (Which doesn't
prove
> >they don't exist!)
>


Well, I have had three personal experiences with the second. Call me what
you will, unscientific, superstitious whatever - I believe.


sistakammi

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: scary shows
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well, I guess you haven t watched Fear and World s Scariest Places then! Those shows have made me a believer, and the proof is in those devices used to
messages.messageBody:
>The difference between "I believe there is life on other planets" and "I
>believe there are ghosts/astral projection" is that the first is based on a
>huge body of concrete data (us!) and testable, provable ideas. The second is
>based only on theories that can't be tested and proved. (Which doesn't prove
>they don't exist!)



Well, I guess you haven't watched "Fear" and "World's Scariest Places" then!
Those shows have made me a believer, and the proof is in those devices used to detect ghostly spirits or apiritions. And SOMETHING must be scaring those people silly so they have to leave the place screaming before they completed their mission!

Karin
(just kidding!)
